title: Instructional Design Scenarios for Learning Transitive Reasoning and Inverse Concepts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Algebra (Groups, Binary Operations, Identity Element Concepts) and Logical Reasoning Skills
context.additional_context: Learners engage in self-directed learning using personal devices in an online asynchronous environment, deepening conceptual understanding through peer collaborative activities

learning_goals: Learners can explain the concept of inverses in various mathematical structures (groups, rings, fields) through transitive reasoning

Learners can apply three reasoning methods—"operation cancellation via inverses," "inverses as manipulated elements," and "understanding inverses through binary operations·identity elements·set interactions"—to practical problems
Learners can demonstrate integrated understanding of inverse concepts through peer evaluation and feedback processes using LMS-based collaboration tools

resources: LMS (Learning Management System) Discussion Board & Assignment Submission Feature

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
